maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve an API key from the MaaS360 web services API.
The `Connect-MaaS360PS` function retrieves an API key from the MaaS360 web services API.

The first time the function is ran, you must utilize the `[POST]` method as well as all applicable parameters to authenticate against MaaS360's endpoint. If you follow-up your initial run with another but utilizing the `[GET]` parameter, you can retrieve information regarding your session.
Billing number for your MaaS360 account.
HTTP method used to send a request.
Randomly generated identifier granted to user.
Version of the application in your MaaS360 instance.
Randomly generated identifier usually containing your billing number.
Enter same credentials utilized to log into MaaS360 web portal.
Return more details information regarding your connection.
Billing number for your MaaS360 account.
HTTP method used to send a request.
Randomly generated identifier granted to user.
Version of the application in your MaaS360 instance.
Randomly generated identifier usually containing your billing number.
Enter same credentials utilized to log into MaaS360 web portal.
Return more details information regarding your connection.

maml:alert.maml:para: All parameter values can be found in the MaaS360 MDM portal under Setup > Manage Access Key and Setup > Documentation. You must FIRST create an app within the MaaS360 MDM portal before you can obtain most of the required information. You must be an administrator to do so.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Connect-MaaS360PS -PlatformID '0' -BillingID '01234567' -AppID '01234567_beans' -AppVersion '1.0' -AppAccessKey 'bDrt224GZ' -Credentials 'john_bono@u2.music' -Method 'Post'
Initial command that should be run when first connecting to your MaaS360 instance. If an API key is successfully retrieved it will run Test-MaaS360PSConnection to be sure the API key is valid. If the default 'MaaS token=""' is returned, then the command will fail asking the user to run the command again to generate a new API key.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Connect-MaaS360PS -Method 'Get'
Retrieving assumed connection status. If the command is ran with the [GET] method before retrieving an API key, the command will fail asking the user to run the command with the [POST] method to retrieve one.

command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> {{ Add example code here }}

maml:description.maml:para: Get user(s) from a MaaS360 instance.
The `Get-MaaS360User` function is used to obtain a single, few, or many users from a MaaS360 instance.
Without any parameters, this function will return ALL users up to the maximum of 250. Luckily, this number can be limited to improve performance.
Specification of all users should be included.
Specification of what page number should to be returned.
Maximum amount of objects that should be returned at once.
Specify if the search should be an exact match or a partial match.
Email address of the user that should be returned.
Full name of the user that should be returned.
Username of the user being searched for.
Email address of the user that should be returned.
Full name of the user that should be returned.
Specification of all users should be included.
Specify if the search should be an exact match or a partial match.
Specification of what page number should to be returned.
Maximum amount of objects that should be returned at once.
Username of the user being searched for.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns info relating to the user Jim Bean.

maml:description.maml:para: Alternative to `Invoke-RestMethod` to send an HTTP request.
The `Invoke-MaaS360Method` function is used internally by other functions to handle the HTTP request instead of utilizing `Invoke-RestMethod`.
Data being sent via POST or PATCH.
HTTP method used to send a request.
Full URL that the request is being sent to.
HTTP headers used in the request.
Used for POST requests where form data is usually sent instead of JSON.
API token being sent in the request.
Data being sent via POST or PATCH.
Used for POST requests where form data is usually sent instead of JSON.
HTTP headers used in the request.
HTTP method used to send a request.
API token being sent in the request.
Full URL that the request is being sent to.

command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> {{ Add example code here }}

maml:description.maml:para: Test connection to a MaaS360 instance.

The `Test-MaaS360PSConnection` function is used to test your connection to a MaaS360 instance utilizing the API key obtained from `Connect-MaaS360PS`. No information is actually formatted or worked on since the main goal is to return `true` if the connection was successful or `false` if it was unsuccessful. Although this function can be used separately, it's used inside of `Connect-MaaS360PS` to validate connection status upon completion.
The billing number of your MaaS360 account.
HTTP method used to send a request.
The billing number of your MaaS360 account.
HTTP method used to send a request.

maml:alert.maml:para: All parameter values can be found in the MaaS360 MDM portal under Setup > Manage Access Key and Setup > Documentation. You must FIRST create an app within the MaaS360 MDM portal before you can obtain most of the required information. You must be an administrator to do so.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Test-MaaS360PSConnection -BillingID '01234567' -Method 'Get' -Verbose -Debug
DEBUG: URI: https://apis.m3.maas360.com/user-apis/user/1.0/search/01234567 DEBUG: TOKENIZED API KEY: MaaS token="4b517b17-d245-443b-9bbd-698773d19f9a-lbfa8j" VERBOSE: Requested HTTP/1.1 GET with 0-byte payload VERBOSE: Received HTTP/1.1 response of content type application/json of unknown size VERBOSE: Content encoding: utf-8 DEBUG: Debug response: @{users=} DEBUG: Connection to [https://apis.m3.maas360.com/user-apis/user/1.0/search/01234567] successful.
True
